title: Secret CIA Bulk Surveillance Program Includes Some Americans’ Records, Senators Say
sub_head: The lawmakers called for the immediate declassification of details about the surveillance program and what data was collected
body:
WASHINGTON—A secret program at the Central Intelligence Agency relied on a form of mass surveillance activity that involved the collection of an unknown data set and included the gathering of some records belonging to Americans, according to a newly declassified letter from two Democratic senators.
Details of the CIA program have been kept from the public as well as some lawmakers, according to the April 2021 letter to the agency from Sens. Ron Wyden (D., Oregon) and Martin Heinrich (D., N.M.), members of the Senate Intelligence Committee. The letter was partially declassified and disclosed Thursday.
